## Variables.renameVariable() function

Opens a prompt that allows the user to enter a new name for a variable. Triggers a rename if the new name is valid. Or re-prompts if there is a collision.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function renameVariable(workspace: Workspace, variable: VariableModel, opt_callback?: (p1?: string | null) => any): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  workspace | [Workspace](./blockly.workspace.md) | The workspace on which to rename the variable. |
|  variable | [VariableModel](./blockly.variablemodel.md) | Variable to rename. |
|  opt\_callback | (p1?: string \| null) =&gt; any | <i>(Optional)</i> A callback. It will be passed an acceptable new variable name, or null if change is to be aborted (cancel button), or undefined if an existing variable was chosen.  Blockly.Variables.renameVariable |

<b>Returns:</b>

void
